revised_title: Observations and Experiments on the Reproduction and Regeneration of the Freshwater Polypus
tldr: The author, Trembley, observes and experiments on the freshwater polypus, an aquatic insect, and discovers its unique ability to reproduce and regenerate. He finds that the polypus can multiply by vegetative reproduction and can regenerate into complete individuals when cut into parts. The polypus's reproduction and regeneration processes are influenced by food availability and environmental conditions.
